data.title: The Last Queen of Algiers Continues Its International Success with Italian Premiere
data.meta_description: BY: Dr. Hana Saada ALGIERS- Since its release in cinemas, the film depicting the life of Princess Zaphira, the last queen of Algiers, has been met with tremendous success and interest from movie enthusiasts, particularly those fond of historical and fictional films. data.text:
BY: Dr. Hana Saada

ALGIERS- Since its release in cinemas, the film depicting the life of Princess Zaphira, the last queen of Algiers, has been met with tremendous success and interest from movie enthusiasts, particularly those fond of historical and fictional films. It’s worth noting that the legend of Zaphira came to life on the small screen, notably on the streaming platform Netflix.

Directed by Adila Bendimerad and Damien Ounouri, the film has toured several international cinemas and garnered numerous awards and accolades.

“The Last Queen” of Algiers Takes Part in C-Movie Film Festival in Italy

The boundless success of this feature film continues with a new destination. This time, the last queen of Algiers makes her debut in Italian cinemas, coinciding with the launch of the first edition of the C-Movie Film Festival.

The event, born in Rimini, Italy, promises a festival entirely dedicated to female cinema. Over four days, from March 20th to 23rd, 2024, the festival offers a rich program of meetings and screenings, focusing on women as actresses, directors, producers, and more.

“The Last Queen,” the Forgotten Figure of Algiers

The release of the Algerian film “The Last Queen” in Italian cinemas is scheduled to begin on March 21st, 2024. This feature film highlights the sometimes blurred line between legend and history.

Directed by Damien Ounouri and Adila Bendimerad, the historical drama recounts the remarkable journey of Zaphira, whose existence was never confirmed but whose story remains intertwined with the city of Algiers.

“The Last Queen” portrays Algiers in 1516, liberated by Salim Toumi with the decisive assistance of the corsair Arroudj Barberousse, who becomes the hero of the city. Despite their alliance, rumors spread through the alleys of the Casbah after the assassination of King Salim Toumi, suggesting that Arroudj himself killed Zaphira’s husband.

Amidst secret negotiations, power struggles, and personal grief, only one person seeks to uncover the truth behind Salim Toumi’s death. One woman chooses to remain in the city while the entire court flees, determined to uncover the true culprits and ensure her son Yahia succeeds his late father one day.

Dzair Tube Media Group

Dzair Tube has firmly established itself as a prominent player among Algerian digital news sites, offering a diverse and enriching content experience. The platform, available in Arabic, French, and English editions, captures the attention of a wide-ranging audience, amassing over half a million daily clicks.

A testament to its commitment to excellence, Dzair Tube received the prestigious President of the Republic’s Award for Professional Journalist in the Electronic Press category on October 22, 2022. This recognition underscores the platform’s unwavering dedication to upholding the highest standards of journalism.

With a significant online presence, Dzair Tube boasts 350,000 subscribers on YouTube, over five million followers on various Facebook pages, and 450,000 subscribers on Instagram. Its digital channel has become a hub for diverse programming, covering news, sports, entertainment, culture, and religion, catering to a broad spectrum of audience preferences.

Equipped with state-of-the-art studios and advanced technology, Dzair Tube’s digital channel has garnered substantial viewership for its varied programs. Hosting interactive discussions with influential figures across different domains, the platform actively fosters public discourse and engagement. Beyond news coverage, Dzair Tube extends its commitment to the production of marketing documentaries, short TV commercials, and high-viewership programs.

The success of the print edition of Dzair Tube’s sports newspaper, “Dzair Sport,” further highlights the platform’s impact, with over 50,000 daily downloads from the official Dzair Tube website.

Recently honored with the Media Leadership Award from the Minister of Communication, Mohamed Laâgab, Dzair Tube continues to shape the landscape of Algerian digital news, maintaining a position of influence and impact in the media industry.
